title: Google’s Moonshot Factory to Review Rio’s Grid for Data Centers
description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google moonshot factory plans to review Rio de Janeiro’s power grid ahead of the potential construction of data centers that would put the city at the forefront of Latin America’s artificial-intelligence industry, according to the city’s vice mayor.

title: Investor Lauren Taylor Wolfe says we are 'absolutely' in an A.I. bubble now
description: Lauren Taylor Wolfe, co-founder of Impactive Capital, said the surge in enthusiasm around artificial intelligence has all the markings of a bubble.
content:
Lauren Taylor Wolfe, co-founder of activist investment firm Impactive Capital, said the surge in enthusiasm around artificial intelligence has all the markings of a bubble.

title: Kenny Loggins demands removal of Trump's AI-generated video
description: Kenny Loggins is objecting to the use of his music in a social media post showing an artificial intelligence-generated video of U.S. President Donald Trump dumping excrement from a fighter jet on last weekend’s “No Kings” protests.
content:

title: France: Fertile AI training ground?
description: GIF-SUR-YVETTE, France — In woody surroundings south of Paris, the campus of Paris-Saclay University provides a fertile training ground for future artificial intelligence (AI) experts, whose skills are coveted at home and abroad.

title: Indian Army signs MoU with Delhi Technological University to boost defence technology and AI skills
description: The Indian Army is enhancing its capabilities through a new partnership with Delhi Technological University. This collaboration will focus on research and training in critical areas like defence technology, artificial intelligence, and cybersecurity. Additionally, the Army is acquiring advanced night sights for its SIG 716 assault rifles. This procurement will significantly improve target engagement capabilities for soldiers.

title: Bible mysteries solved as AI identifies 'authors' and uncovers cryptic language patterns
description: An international team of researchers has used artificial intelligence to analyse the first nine books of the Hebrew Bible, known as Enneateuch
content:
